Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 31 in today's
episode I have an idiom for you cost the
earth or you can say charge the earth do
you know what it means come let's find
out what this idiom means and how you
can use it in your daily conversation
cost the earth or charge the earth in
this idiom the earth refers to land or a
plot we all know we have to spend a lot
of money to own a small piece of land or
you can say earth land always comes
expensive so when you say it costs the
earth it basically means it's very
expensive or costly in other words to
cost the earth means to pay a lot of
money for something in comparison to the
products or services in the similar
category or range so if you say that
something is costing the earth or that
you pay the earth for something you are
emphasizing that it costs a very large
amount of money all right now let's look
at some example sentences on how to use
cost the earth in your daily
conversation example 1 just having a cup
of coffee costs the earth in there it's
ridiculously expensive example 2 it's a
wonderful compact car but they are
charging the earth for it
example3 these shoes cost the earth so
let's get them while they go on a sale
example for owning an apartment in
Mumbai costs the earth the real estate
prices are just try zhing example 5
don't have anything from the little
fridge in your hotel room they charge
the earth for that stuff example 6
mary's dress is real silk
it must have costed her the earth
example 7 taking care of a fancy car
like that can cost the earth let me tell
you for periodic maintenance the company
charges the earth I hope you found this
episode useful and interesting in your
English learning process to practice
your English skills watch all the
episodes of daily video vocabulary you
can subscribe to our YouTube channel and
stay updated with all the new episodes
thank you for watching us take care
